rev.diff:
Line 45: Line 45:
In the case of a [[praying mantis]], necrophilia could be said to be part of their methods of [[reproduction]]. The larger female will often decapitate or even eat her mate during copulation.<ref name="Feldman">{{Cite web|url=http://www.colostate.edu/Depts/Entomology/courses/en507/papers_1999/feldman.htm|title=The Praying Mantis|accessdate = 2007-06-17|author=Dan Feldman}}</ref> However, given that the sexual activity of a male mantis is controlled by a brain-like [[ganglion]]in his abdomen <ref>{{cite web| http://insects.suite101.com/article.cfm/mantid_femme_fatales|title: "Mantid Femme Fatales"}}</ref> it may not be appropriate to refer to him as a "corpse", even when he is decapitated.
In the case of a [[praying mantis]], necrophilia could be said to be part of their methods of [[reproduction]]. The larger female will often decapitate or even eat her mate during copulation.<ref name="Feldman">{{Cite web|url=http://www.colostate.edu/Depts/Entomology/courses/en507/papers_1999/feldman.htm|title=The Praying Mantis|accessdate = 2007-06-17|author=Dan Feldman}}</ref> However, given that the sexual activity of a male mantis is controlled by a brain-like [[ganglion]]in his abdomen <ref>{{cite web| http://insects.suite101.com/article.cfm/mantid_femme_fatales|title: "Mantid Femme Fatales"}}</ref> it may not be appropriate to refer to him as a "corpse", even when he is decapitated.
  +
a necrophilliac is an imortal pineapple farmer who is attracted to frogs that crap on dogs.
